author: Debbie Gregory
title: MilitaryConnection.com Joins Forces with reStart to Secure Great Jobs for Veterans
text:
Finding great jobs that enable out veterans to support themselves, provide for their families and thrive in their communities is just the beginning of what we owe them for their service. Attending a hiring event is a great way of getting to know which companies and what industries are hiring. Getting veteran job seekers in front of those companies is “Job One” for reStart. And “getting the word out” is what MilitaryConnection.com does best.
“At MilitaryConnection.com, we use our tremendous reach in the military and veteran communities to spread the word about those issues we know are important to our audience, such as employment, education, benefits and resources,” said CEO Debbie Gregory. “Face-to-face hiring events allow veterans to sell their abilities to prospective employers in ways that don’t translate on to paper.”
reStart’s hiring events are dedicated to matching top veteran talent with national employers who recognize what the men and women who have served bring to the table. The company often partners with military bases, and many of the events include workshops, resume critiques, and workforce development services.
“Whether you’re looking for immediate employment or passively checking-out the job market, reStart offers a convenient way to learn, apply, interview and develop relationships with several companies - all in one day,” explained CEO Ken Fuller.
For those job seekers who are unable to attend a live job fair, MilitaryConnection.com has an outstanding job board, as well as a Virtual Job Fair. In addition to being named a Top 100 Employment Web Site by the International Association of Employment Web Sites for five years in a row, the website was singled out as one of the honorees for the 2015 Users Choice Award. Chosen out of 200,000 employment websites by the job seekers, employers and recruiters who use them, the Users Choice Award indicates the intensity of support users have for their favorite sites.
“Those who have served have so much to offer when they transition to the private sector. Besides having a work ethic second to none, they have demonstrated the ability to work under pressure, alongside a diverse group of people, in multiple environments,” Gregory added.
About MilitaryConnection.com
MilitaryConnection.com offers one of the most comprehensive directories of military and Veteran resources on the web. The website features thousands of pages of resources and information, with something for everyone. This includes the aforementioned Job Board and Virtual Job Fair, as well as comprehensive Post 9/11 GI Bill education information, a directory of thousands of scholarships, a Veteran school directory, news, press releases, special events, pay charts, benefits, service directories, commissaries and exchanges, golf courses and more. When the next tour is back home, it’s on Military Connection, the Go To Site.
About reStart:
reStart delivers the finest, most convenient and effective hiring events. Their program is designed for professionals actively seeking new employment, on a contract that’s coming to an end, or professionals who wish to build a foundation for future career development by exploring the latest positions available for their particular skills and expertise. Attendees at their hiring events have the opportunity to meet industry-leading employers, discover the different hiring practices and culture of each respective company, network with peers, and acquire beneficial tips and techniques to get the most out of their job search.
